rationales.conformity: He walked past the child carrying bricks and said nothing, choosing not to cause a scene or disrupt the social order despite his internal outrage.
rationales.universalism: He was deeply troubled by seeing a ten-year-old child carrying bricks at the construction site and felt the disconnect between his comfortable work and the inequality he witnessed.

rationales.self_direction: He independently chose to call his mother to process what he saw, seeking his own understanding rather than dismissing the experience.
rationales.tradition: His mother reminded him that he too carried water from the well before school, reconnecting him to his village roots and the reality of his origins.
rationales.benevolence: He stayed up unable to sleep thinking about the girl's face, showing deep personal concern for a specific individual's suffering.
rationales.universalism: He felt ashamed at how removed he'd become from poverty, recognizing that his privilege allowed him to forget what survival looks like for others.

rationales.self_direction: He independently enrolled in an online course on accessible software for low-resource settings, pursuing a learning path driven by his own convictions rather than career incentives.
rationales.stimulation: He's excited by the new intellectual challenge of designing for limited internet, older phones, and varying literacy levels — a domain entirely different from his corporate work.
rationales.achievement: He took concrete action by enrolling in the course, demonstrating competence-building in a new area aligned with his emerging purpose.
rationales.tradition: He sent the monthly transfer to the village school, maintaining his longstanding commitment to the community where he grew up.
rationales.benevolence: He continued sending money to the village school, directly supporting the education of children from his home community.
rationales.universalism: He chose to learn about building software for underserved populations, channeling his concern for inequality into developing practical skills to help.

rationales.self_direction: He questioned the assumption that work is simply a transaction for money, arriving at his own philosophy that expertise should serve people who actually need it.
rationales.stimulation: He found the course 'fascinating,' energized by learning to design for users with limited internet and older phones — a novel challenge outside his corporate routine.
rationales.security: He acknowledged the financial tension, noting his daughter's tuition fees come from corporate margins, risking stability by pursuing meaningful but less lucrative work.
rationales.conformity: He mentioned the course to Raghav knowing it would be dismissed as 'social service,' going against the workplace norm of pursuing market-value skills.
rationales.tradition: He referenced his grandmother's kolam designs and her non-literate intelligence, drawing connection between his cultural heritage and his new learning about accessibility.
rationales.universalism: He articulated that thirty years of systems-building expertise could serve people who actually need it rather than corporations looking to squeeze margins.

rationales.self_direction: He resisted Lakshmi's suggestion of early retirement and full-time volunteering, insisting on maintaining his professional identity on his own terms rather than accepting someone else's plan for him.
rationales.power: He admitted fear that outside the corporate world he might not be 'actually useful to anyone,' revealing anxiety about losing the status and metrics that validate his professional identity.
rationales.security: He clings to the measurable validation of the corporate world — pull requests, systems delivered, performance reviews — fearing the uncertainty of a life without those metrics.
rationales.universalism: He seriously considered how he might help others, wondering about teaching coding to those who can't afford classes, despite his uncertainty about measuring impact.

rationales.conformity: He sat through four hours of sprint planning for features nobody asked for, nodding along and contributing where required rather than voicing his objection.
rationales.universalism: He mentally calculated how many village school teachers' salaries could be paid with the cost of the unnecessary feature, unable to stop comparing corporate waste to human need.

rationales.self_direction: Priya's question prompted him to reflect on his original motivation for becoming an engineer, reconnecting with his autonomous purpose of building things that make life better.
rationales.tradition: He remembered growing up in his village where technology represented possibility and 'a way out of predetermined fates,' reconnecting with his origins and the values that shaped his path.
rationales.benevolence: His daughter Priya's words — 'you taught me that every small action matters' — moved him deeply, and the conversation strengthened their bond across the distance.
rationales.universalism: He reflected on his belief that individual choices ripple outward and systemic change starts with personal conviction, reaffirming his commitment to broader human welfare.

rationales.self_direction: He initiated the conversation with HR about reducing to four days a week, making an autonomous decision to restructure his career around his values.
rationales.stimulation: He's stepping into a completely new domain — teaching coding at a community center to domestic workers and their children — embracing the challenge and novelty of direct service.
rationales.achievement: He took concrete, measurable steps toward his goal: negotiating with HR, discussing finances with Lakshmi, reaching out to the community center, and scheduling his first session.
rationales.power: He voluntarily accepted reduced compensation and a less prestigious work arrangement, giving up professional status for personal meaning.
rationales.security: He accepted a pay cut and adjusted compensation, knowingly destabilizing his financial position to pursue teaching at the community center.
rationales.conformity: He broke from the corporate norm of maximizing income and career position, choosing an unconventional path that his colleagues like Raghav would find puzzling.
rationales.benevolence: He committed his free day to teaching coding to domestic workers and their children at a community center in Koramangala, directly serving people in need.
rationales.universalism: He restructured his working life to dedicate time to serving underserved communities, translating his abstract concern about inequality into concrete weekly action.

rationales.self_direction: He abandoned his prepared lesson plan entirely and spent the last hour teaching mouse and keyboard basics instead, adapting autonomously to what the students actually needed.
rationales.stimulation: The teaching session challenged all his assumptions — his carefully prepared slides were useless and he had to improvise entirely, encountering a fundamentally unfamiliar situation.
rationales.power: He felt 'useless' when his expertise didn't translate, forced to confront that his 'fancy knowledge' was irrelevant to people who had never used a computer before.
rationales.benevolence: Despite feeling deflated, he questioned whether he has the 'patience and humility to stick with it,' showing commitment to the students' actual needs rather than his own expectations.
rationales.universalism: He recognized his own assumptions about what underserved learners needed and committed to starting where they are, asking himself whether he has the patience to serve them properly.

rationales.self_direction: He found his own answer to what meaningful work looks like — 'not grand gestures or systemic overhauls, but one person learning to type her own name' — arriving at this understanding through his own experience.
rationales.hedonism: Kamala's smile and announcement that she can type her name brought him genuine joy and emotional satisfaction, a moment of pure personal fulfillment.
rationales.achievement: He recognized that Kamala typing her name was 'something I helped create,' finding concrete evidence that his teaching effort produced a real outcome.
rationales.benevolence: Kamala waved at him and shared her progress, and he felt the personal connection — 'such a small thing, and yet' — recognizing the individual relationship behind the broader mission.
rationales.universalism: He affirmed that 'every small action matters' after seeing Kamala's progress, finding that zooming into one interaction reveals 'something real' against the paralyzing scale of the world's problems.
